job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Cabot, PA
pros: Nice pay Good seniority bonuses
cons: Short staffed all the time

pros: This company goes above and beyond in terms of patient oriented care and care for employees as well. I have never worked at a company where the feeling truly is shared community. This companies mission is caring for individuals whether its patients, community, employees, employees families even. The work place structure is relaxed and compassionate. Managers are approachable, friendly, and understanding. There is never a problem that is dealt with solo- team work is utilized for every new obstacle. The work is truly gratifying because everyone's efforts within the company add to quality of care. No day is the same due to healthcare being unpredictable, but that keeps the job intriguing! If you have a "helper heart" this is definitely a place for you.
cons: The job is healthcare so it is all hands on deck all the time. At times it is difficult to not take the emotions home due to the nature of the business of life/death.

pros: leaving work knowing you helped someone in need was a great feeling
cons: we were always short staffed

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Cabot, PA
pros: Great place for new nurses to expand their knowledge and practice skills.
cons: As with all nursing the skilled patient to nurse ratio was just too much. After years of wearing thin it takes a toll.

job_title: BSN- RN Staff Nurse in Cabot, PA

Growth in company mainly awarded based on who is friends with who, not experience or education. Lack of solid education/training/support for new staff. Good people leave.

pros:
Baden office was a family-like environment. This was my first job out of nursing school and I had so much support from the clinical coordinators. I learned so much from them. 
The management in the Baden office, Specifically Danielle, Andrea, Joanna, and Tom were wonderful to me.
cons:
Somewhere around 2018, the company went from feeling very family like to just feeling like a number.  
The management team began to feel the pressure from corporate to never turn down a referral.  It got to a point that every time we worked, you might as well say we were on call as well.  Phone constantly ringing. Scheduling harassing you all day to pick up visits that they either missed or didn’t prioritize correctly.
The scheduling department was absolutely horrible.  Schedules for the next day sometimes didn’t come out until 10 o’clock at night and our patients expected a phone call the evening before their visit in order to schedule.

pros: Always looking forward to working with the residents.
cons: Management is not always on the same page.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in New Kensington, PA
pros: Incentives, nice pay, continuing education, their 401 plan, they had parties and food for staff often.
cons: A lot of the staff had bad attitudes, lots of call offs, gossiping. Some nurses expected you do too things you weren’t supposed to do.

pros: Flexible, amazing management, understanding, family, supportive, great hours, great pay.
cons: Zero, ziltch, nada, none, they’re amazing!

review_title: Pays well but some staffing problems
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Allison Park, PA
pros:
High pay compared to other facilities in the area
Residents are great
Concordia overall has good intentions with its mission/values
Nice community
cons:
Never enough staff (although this is obviously a problem at many nursing homes)
Some of the employees were incredibly unprofessional, and management never seemed to do anything about it because they were just desperate to keep anyone who was wiling to stick around
20 residents per aide for Personal Care was just too many, especially given that many of the residents were actually closer to a skilled nursing level of care -- it wasn't impossible, but you just didn't have the time to give the residents the type of care they really needed
None of the aides take a break, ever (even though you are there for 8.5 hours and paid for 8)

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Cheswick, PA
pros: Competitive pay: free food: great families
cons: No structure;  care more about making money than the actual residents;  very poor staffing,   There is absolutely no structure to this place for the LPN.  When working, one is in charge of call offs not to mention the whole building: managing alarms, falls and the list goes on and on; nthere were days that you hea just would spin. NyQuil are responsible for all orders, doctors and outside staff are there almost on a daily basis and need to speak with the Lpn as well.   The safety of staff is not taken seriously.  In the midst of crisis, they do not treat everyone the same.  If they want you gone, they will take photos of things and blame it on you, until you resign.  Management treats staff very unprofessional and will humiliate in front of coworkers.  Sorry, I stand for what I beLieve.  For a Lutheran ministry, I have not heard f bombs used by staff so frequently.  Oh, I almost forgot, in the role of charge nurse, you have to deal with the fights among the caregivers as well.  It has been the worst experience I have had in many years as an LPN

pros: Many nice coworkers, pay per visit helped, but 10 + visits a day is not good for patients.
cons: Several Nurses in upper management were just dreadful people. Always said mean things about staff behind closed doors. No empathy for patients, just a pair of nasty old cats.

pros: Field staff covered small geographic areas- paid per visit, you could make a very good living.
cons: Upper management staff were vicious.  Constantly said hateful things about staff, you knew when you left the room they were stabbing your back.   Absolutely no interest in patients or patient needs by upper management. Only money.

job_title: Food Service Aid in Cabot, PA

cons: Students struggle with sticking to schedules and are not always the most helpful to switch shifts. Depending on the time of year, understaffed.

review_title: Great place to work, especially for entry-level. Very welcoming

cons: Weekend shifts but rotate with others on admission team, some slower days but enjoyable environment and co-workers make days go fast
